newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: GOVERNMENT, IMF PLAN NEW RELATIONSHIP.
newsitem.headline: GOVERNMENT, IMF PLAN NEW RELATIONSHIP.

text.p: The Lithuanian government said on Monday that it had reached an agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to change the nature of its cooperation with the fund after its memorandum expires in September.
"The government will submit its offers concerning future cooperation with the IMF in the second half of June," the government's press office said in a statement.
"At the start of July, the form of future cooperation should be estabilished, which should not be connected with any financial obligations," the statement added.

"This does not mean that Lithuania has a big surplus of funds...But since 1992, Lithuania has made big progress and that's why it is necessary to look for cooperation arrangements suitable for countries in the last stage of reform," it said.
The government announced last March its intention to stop borrowing money from the IMF after September.
